titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Moreau Forrest Letter to Mary Forrest, 1837 MS 002

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-29 14:09:42 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Moreau Forrest Letter to Mary Forrest
did.abstract: Written in 1837 from Houston, Forrest writes at length to his wife about Houston, and the illness of their son; discusses the possible outbreak of war with Mexico; talks of the Texas Congress meeting. This four-page letter gives an early look at life in the Republic of Texas.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mention of Moreau Forrest as candidate for Mayor of Houston can be found in the folder on George Fisher in the Muir papers (collection #MS 17).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Written in 1837 from Houston, Forrest writes at length to his wife about Houston, and the illness of their son; discusses the possible outbreak of war with Mexico; talks of the Texas Congress meeting. This four-page letter gives an early look at life in the Republic of Texas.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research. Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Moreau Forrest Letter to Mary Forrest must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Moreau Forrest Letter to Mary Forrest, 1837, MS 002, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: This collection is available online at: https://scholarship.rice.edu/handle/1911/20746

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 4 pg. letter, torn in portions of fold.
